newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP buys 25.2 pct of software house. [CORRECTED 14:35 GMT]
newsitem.headline: SAP buys 25.2 pct of software house. [CORRECTED 14:35 GMT]

text.p: German software group SAP AG said on Friday it would buy 25.2 percent of IDS Prof. Scheer GmbH, an information systems consultant that specialises in SAP's R/3 enterprise management software.
The companies plan to work together to develop software for municipalities. They would also cooperate in logistics, business engineering and software architecture.
The transaction required approval of SAP's supervisory board as well as Germany's cartel office.
IDS, based on Saarbruecken, had 1996 revenue of 90 million (Corrects from 900 million) marks ($521.7 million) and has clients around the world.

SAP is world's largest developer of business application software used to control corporate payroll, personnel, purchasing, manufacturing and financial data. It had sales of 3.72 billion marks in 1996.
-- Neal Boudette, Bonn Newsroom, +49-228 26097150 ($ = 1.725 German Marks)
